str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A commander of a thousand men, a military tribune. From chilioi and archo; the commander of a thousand soldiers

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Trans: I bring near; intrans: I come near, approach. From eggus; to make near, i.e. approach.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To lay hold of, take hold of, seize (sometimes with beneficent, sometimes with hostile, intent).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To command, order, direct, bid. From a primary kello; 'hail'; to incite by word, i.e. Order.
To bind, tie, fasten; I impel, compel; I declare to be prohibited and unlawful. A primary verb; to bind.
A (light) chain, bond. Of uncertain derivation; a fetter or manacle.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To ask, inquire, ascertain by inquiry, understand.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Optative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
